info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 20 at 8:55PM CDT until May 24 at 9:24AM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri...
Roubidoux Creek Near Waynesville affecting Pulaski County.
Marmaton River near Nevada affecting Vernon County.
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri...
Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County.
For the Roubidoux Creek...including Waynesville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Little Osage River...including Horton...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Marmaton River...including Nevada...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Marmaton River near Nevada.
* WHEN...Until late Saturday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, the county road west of the gage, Minnie Ball Road, is impassable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 24.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 PM CDT Tuesday was 24.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 24.8 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 815 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SATURDAY MORNING
